p:
The Government of Pakistan restructured its national health policy in 2001 after signing up to the Millenium Development Goals and began developing preventive health-care programmes.
356 The Prime Minister's National Health Program of state-sponsored health insurance was launched in 2015, specifically aimed at Pakistani citizens living below the poverty line. Additionally, in the past decade, many digital start-up companies have been established to facilitate health-care delivery at all levels (eg, accessing health information, booking doctor appointments, ordering medications, or request laboratory tests and sample collection, and maintaining up-to-date medical records).
